meanings.definition: To analyze too much or too deeply.
meanings.sent1: She overanalyses every decision she makes, causing unnecessary stress.
meanings.sent2: He often overanalyses his performance at work, leading to self-doubt.
meanings.sent3: The detective overanalyses the smallest clues, making the case more complicated than it needs to be.
meanings.sent4: She overanalyses her dreams as if they hold the key to her future.
meanings.sent5: Overanalysing can sometimes cloud our judgment and prevent us from taking action.

meanings.definition: The act of analyzing something excessively.
meanings.sent1: His constant overanalyses of the situation only made it more confusing.
meanings.sent2: The overanalyses of the data led to conflicting interpretations.
meanings.sent3: The overanalyses of the weather forecast made everyone laugh at the exaggerated predictions.
meanings.sent4: Her overanalyses of the painting revealed hidden details no one else noticed.
meanings.sent5: The overanalyses of the book's ending left the readers divided in their opinions.
